glsa.title: gif2png: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in gif2png, the worst of which might allow execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: gif2png converts images from GIF format to PNG format.

description.p: Two vulnerabilities have been found in gif2png:

ul.li: A boundary error in gif2png.c could cause a buffer overflow (CVE-2010-4694).
The patch for CVE-2009-5018 causes gif2png to truncate GIF pathnames (CVE-2010-4695).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted GIF file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service condition, or the creation of PNG files in unintended directories.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
